result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kalvin Darnell Wilson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kalvin Darnell Wilson appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Kalvin Darnell Wilson.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing hearing date. Case is adjourned to 11-23-22 at 9:00 am for plea and sentencing in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kalvin Darnell Wilson appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Kalvin Darnell Wilson.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties are still negotiating and requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 10-14-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Motion on postconviction relief hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kalvin Darnell Wilson in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Attorney Golden was recently appointed, and advises that he is still awaiting discovery materials and an offer from the State. Defense further requests an additional status conference date. Case adjourned to Br 10.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 077806,
Payable Number: 1025867,
Receipt Number: 22RP032616,
Amount: $20.00
SPD contacted the clerk via email stating the defendant does not qualify needs to be interviewed.

Defendant Kalvin Darnell Wilson in court.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin   All parties appeared by video conference.
Case in court for status of counsel.  No attorney has been appointed yet.  Case is adjourned to 8-15-22 at 8:30 am for status of counsel by zoom.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kalvin Darnell Wilson in court.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defendant will be attempting private counsel.  Case adjourned for Status of Counsel.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with CRO and NLO
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
 The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
 No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Kalvin Darnell Wilson in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 10.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 150.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Kalvin Darnell Wilson not in court.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/02/2022@0130
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/2/22 @ 1:30p
